description: This notification, if the agent is so configured, may be sent when the
system has detected a material change in physical condition of the
hardware
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvHardwareEvent VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwSubsystemType i 1 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwHardwareStatus i 1 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEventDescription s EXAMPLE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvHardwareTime s EXAMPLEE

description: Hardware component reporting environmental state
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwSubsystemType

description: Last reported state of this component
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwHardwareStatus

description: Human readable description of this event
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEventDescription

description: Timestamp as reported from BMC for the SEL entry.
See CLI: 'localcli hardware ipmi sel list' for same report.
Note that BMC maintains it own clock and may not be the same
as the time ESX itself reports. On ESX: the CLI command:
localcli hardware ipmi sel get
reports the BMC clock.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvHardwareTime

description: ESX Specific version of this notification
if the agent is so configured, may be sent when
the ESX Operating System has detected a material change in
physical condition of the hardware
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwESXEnvHardwareEvent VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwSubsystemType i 1 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwHardwareStatus i 1 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEventDescription s EXAMPLE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvHardwareTime s EXAMPLEE

description: Hardware component reporting environmental state
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwSubsystemType

description: Last reported state of this component
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwHardwareStatus

description: Human readable description of this event
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEventDescription

description: Timestamp as reported from BMC for the SEL entry.
See CLI: 'localcli hardware ipmi sel list' for same report.
Note that BMC maintains it own clock and may not be the same
as the time ESX itself reports. On ESX: the CLI command:
localcli hardware ipmi sel get
reports the BMC clock.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvHardwareTime

description: A hardware alert as received from the Common Infrastructure Management (CIM) subsystem on this system.
REFERENCE http://www.dmtf.org/standards/cim/cim_schema_v2240 : file CIM_AlertIndication.mof
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwESXEnvHardwareAlert VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvDescription s EXAMPLE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvEventTime s EXAMPLEE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvIndicationTime s EXAMPLEE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvPerceivedSeverity i 0 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertType i 1 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSysCreationClassName s EXAMPLE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertingElement s EXAMPLE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertingFormat i 0 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSystemName s EXAMPLE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvProviderName s EXAMPLE

description: A short description of the Indication.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvDescription

description: The time and date the underlying event was first
detected. May be set to the time the SNMP agent recieved the notification
if in the incoming CIM indication the value is
NULL due to the creating entity not being capable of providing
this information. This value is based on the notion of
local date and time of the Managed System Element
generating the Indication.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvEventTime

description: The time and date of creation of the underlying Indication received by the snmp agent. The
property may be set to the time SNMP agent received the notification if the entity creating the
Indication is not capable of determining this
information and delivers a null IndicationTime property. Note that IndicationTime may be the same
for two Indications that are generated in rapid succession.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvIndicationTime

description: An enumerated value that describes the severity of the
Alert Indication from the notifier's point of view.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvPerceivedSeverity

description: Primary classification of the Indication.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertType

description: The scoping System's CreationClassName for the Provider
generating this Indication.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSysCreationClassName

description: The identifying information of the entity (ie, the
instance) for which this notification is generated. The
property contains the CIM path of an CIM object instance
encoded as a string parameter - if the instance is modeled in the CIM
Schema. If not a CIM instance, the property contains
some identifying string that names the entity for which
the Alert is generated. The path or identifying string
is formatted per the AlertingElementFormat property.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertingElement

description: The format of the AlertingManagedElement property is
interpretable based upon the value of this property.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertingFormat

description: The scoping System's Name for the Provider generating this message.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSystemName

description: The name of the CIM provider, a software module loaded into the CIM subsystem, generating this message.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvProviderName

description: A battery alert as received from the Common Infrastructure Management (CIM) subsystem on this system.
REFERENCE http://www.dmtf.org/standards/cim/cim_schema_v2240 : file CIM_AlertIndication.mof

variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvIndicationTime

description: An enumerated value that describes the severity of the
Alert Indication from the notifier's point of view.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvPerceivedSeverity

description: Primary classification of the Indication.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertType

description: The scoping System's CreationClassName for the Provider
generating this Indication.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSysCreationClassName

description: The identifying information of the entity (ie, the
instance) for which this notification is generated. The
property contains the CIM path of an CIM object instance
encoded as a string parameter - if the instance is modeled in the CIM
Schema. If not a CIM instance, the property contains
some identifying string that names the entity for which
the Alert is generated. The path or identifying string
is formatted per the AlertingElementFormat property.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertingElement

description: The format of the AlertingManagedElement property is
interpretable based upon the value of this property.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvAlertingFormat

description: The scoping System's Name for the Provider generating this message.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSystemName

description: The name of the CIM provider, a software module loaded into the CIM subsystem, generating this message.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvProviderName

description: An IPMI System Event Log has fixed amount of entries (65535). This event is sent once when
the managed object vmwSELCapacity reaches 100% capacity at which point new entries
to the SEL will be dropped if overflow is not enabled (default) on most hardware systems.
This event will rearm any time vmwSELCapacity.0 drops below 80%.
REFERENCE [1] section 31 System Event Log (SEL) Commands

event.Summary: IPMI system event log entries limit reached the maximum (65535)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvIpmiSelFull VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwSELCapacity i 0

description: The amount of free space left in the IPMI SEL for new entries.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwSELCapacity

description: A memory related IPMI SDR has updated IPMI SEL with record id of vmwEnvIndex with state asserted.
The vmwEnvTable will have an entry at vmwEnvIndex with additional details
REFERENCE [1] section 32 byte 11
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvIpmiSelMemoryRaised VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSelSensorNumber i 0 VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvHardwareTime s EXAMPLEE VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEventDescription s EXAMPLE

description: This is the BMC reported Sensor Number byte 12 from SEL Event record
as per Table 32 section 32.1 SEL Event Records [1].
IPMI Sensors are reported in hrDeviceTable and vmwEnvTable provides
the mapping to the specific entry there. Also from CLI on ESX the command:
localcli hardware ipmi sdr list
can provide the listing of IPMI Sensors that has entered this SEL record.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvSelSensorNumber

description: Timestamp as reported from BMC for the SEL entry.
See CLI: 'localcli hardware ipmi sel list' for same report.
Note that BMC maintains it own clock and may not be the same
as the time ESX itself reports. On ESX: the CLI command:
localcli hardware ipmi sel get
reports the BMC clock.
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEnvHardwareTime

description: Human readable description of this event
variables.name: VMWARE-ENV-MIB::vmwEventDescription

description: A memory related IPMI SDR has updated IPMI SEL with record id of vmwEnvIndex with state deasserted
The vmwEnvTable will have an entry at vmwEnvIndex with additional details
